purpleculture_pinyin:
fǔ
kettle; cauldron
чайник; котел
rtega_mnemonic:
釜釜RScauldron, pot, kettle
  • father's 父 hands 又 holding a metal 金 pot to be put on the table
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 父 indicates the sound; 金 (metal) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
釜底抽薪 [ fǔ dǐ chōu xīn ]: to take drastic measures to deal with a situation; to pull the carpet from under sb
破釜沉舟 [ pò fǔ chén zhōu ]: lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat; to burn one's boats
釜底游鱼 [ fǔ dǐ yóu yú ]: a fish at the bottom of the pot (idiom); in a desperate situation
釜山 [ fǔ shān ]: Busan Metropolitan City in South Gyeongsang Province 庆尚南道 , South Korea
釜山市 [ fǔ shān shì ]: Busan Metropolitan City in South Gyeongsang Province 庆尚南道 , South Korea

heisig_story: Father . . . metal. Note the stroke overlap between father and metal.
koohiiStory1: Your father uses his legs to stop himself from being put in a metal cauldron.
koohiiStory2: Whilst on holiday, my father was captured by cannibals and put in a metal cauldron.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 丶 (капля), ノ, 并, 干 (сухой), 父 (отец), 王 (монарх), 金 (золото)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the father (父) puts the eight (丷) kings (王) in his iron pot
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " Fu ", " Father " sound, Warring States bamboo slips from " Gold ", " Father " sound, " Fo " is a ceramic vessel, and " Gold " means metal. The " kettle " was originally an ancient cooking utensil, and was used as a measuring instrument during the Warring States period. The " kettle " is used as a cooking utensil, with a closed mouth, a round bottom, or two ears. It is used like a 鬲, placed in the mouth of the stove, and placed on the retort for cooking. Popular in the Han Dynasty. There are iron, copper and ceramics. The " kettle " was used as a measuring instrument and was popular in Qi during the Spring and Autumn Period and the Warring States Period. There are both Zihezi Keke and Chen Chunke Kettle from the Warring States Period, both in the shape of an altar, with a small mouth and a big belly and two ears. The volume of the Zihezi kettle is 20.46 liters, and the volume of the Chen Chun kettle is 20.58 liters. The volume is very close to that of Shang Yang and Xin Mang Jia ("Chinese Dictionary"). The inscription means measuring device, Zihezi Kettle: "Zuoguan Keke Festival is in the Keke", "Zuoguan" is the name of a place, meaning that the value of Zuoguan Keke should be governed by the official storehouse, that is, the Keke As the value standard of Zuoguan Keke (Ma Chengyuan).

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are called " axes ". "Wu Ming" Jane 5: "Cauldron (axe) Hu (钺) power".

The small seal of the character " kettle " is used for "鬴", " fu " is the sound symbol, and "鬲" is the meaning symbol, because the " kettle " and 鬲 used as a cooking vessel are both steamers. "Said Wen": "Yuan, Yuan belongs to. From 鬲, Fu Sheng. 𨥏 (Cauldron), Li or Congjin, Father's Voice." Duan Yucai's note: "Today's classics are mostly made of kettles, but "Zhou Li" is used as 鬴.""poetry. Zhao Nan. "Ping Ping": "Yi Xiangzhi, Wei Qi and Kettle." Mao Heng Chuan: "Xiang, Heng Ye. Qi, Ke Ping belongs to the genus of Ke, where there is enough to say Qi, and there is no enough to say Kettle." It means what to use for cooking, with Qi And the kettle.
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscriptions from " Fu ", " Father " sound, Warring States bamboo slips from " Gold ", " Father " sound, the original meaning is an ancient cooking utensils, this kind of cooking utensils is made of ceramics, so from " Fu ", there are metal , So from " gold ".
humanum_full_description:
金文從「缶」，「父」聲，戰國竹簡從「金」，「父」聲，「缶」是陶製器皿，「金」表示金屬製的。「釜」原為古炊器，戰國時被用作量器。「釜」作為炊器，斂口，圜底，或有二耳。其用如鬲，置於灶口，上置甑以蒸煮。盛行於漢代。有鐵製的，也有銅和陶製的。「釜」作為量器，春秋、戰國時代流行於齊國，現存有戰國時的子禾子釜和陳純釜，都作壇形，小口大腹，有兩耳。子禾子釜的容積爲20.46公升，陳純釜的容積爲20.58公升。與商鞅量、新莽嘉量的容積已很接近（《漢語大詞典》）。金文表示量器，子禾子釜：「左關釜節于稟釜」，「左關」是地名，意謂左關釜的量值應受節于官方倉稟之釜，即以稟釜作為左關釜的量值標準（馬承源）。

　　戰國竹簡通假為「斧」，《上博竹書七．吳命》簡5：「釜（斧）戉（鉞）之威」。

　　「釜」字小篆作「鬴」，「甫」是聲符，「鬲」是義符，因為作為炊器的「釜」與鬲同為蒸煮器。《說文》：「鬴，鍑屬。从鬲，甫聲。𨥏（釜），鬴或从金，父聲。」段玉裁注：「今經典多作釜，惟《周禮》作鬴。」《詩．召南．采蘋》：「于以湘之，維錡及釜。」毛亨傳：「湘，亨也。錡，釜屬，有足曰錡，無足曰釜。」意謂用甚麼來烹煮，用錡和釜。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「缶」，「父」聲，戰國竹簡從「金」，「父」聲，本義是一種古代炊器，這種炊器有陶製的，故從「缶」，有金屬製的，故從「金」。

釜(かま): iron pot, kettle

金文從「 缶 」，「 父 」聲，戰國竹簡從「 金 」，「 父 」聲，「 缶 」是陶製器皿，「 金 」表示金屬製的。「 釜 」原為古炊器，戰國時被用作量器。「 釜 」作為炊器，斂口，圜底，或有二耳。其用如鬲，置於灶口，上置甑以蒸煮。盛行於漢代。有鐵製的，也有銅和陶製的。「 釜 」作為量器，春秋、戰國時代流行於齊國，現存有戰國時的子禾子釜和陳純釜，都作壇形，小口大腹，有兩耳。子禾子釜的容積爲20.46公升，陳純釜的容積爲20.58公升。與商鞅量、新莽嘉量的容積已很接近（《漢語大詞典》）。金文表示量器，子禾子釜：「左關釜節于稟釜」，「左關」是地名，意謂左關釜的量值應受節于官方倉稟之釜，即以稟釜作為左關釜的量值標準（馬承源）。 戰國竹簡通假為「 斧 」，《上博竹書七．吳命》簡5：「釜（斧）戉（鉞）之威」。 「 釜 」字小篆作「 鬴 」，「 甫 」是聲符，「 鬲 」是義符，因為作為炊器的「 釜 」與鬲同為蒸煮器。《說文》：「鬴，鍑屬。从鬲，甫聲。𨥏（釜），鬴或从金，父聲。」段玉裁注：「今經典多作釜，惟《周禮》作鬴。」《詩．召南．采蘋》：「于以湘之，維錡及釜。」毛亨傳：「湘，亨也。錡，釜屬，有足曰錡，無足曰釜。」意謂用甚麼來烹煮，用錡和釜。

Seal characters (1)

釜字的基本解释

釜
fǔ
古代的一种锅：釜底抽薪。破釜沉舟。
中国春秋战国时量器名，亦是容量单位，标准不一。

釜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fǔ］
［《廣韻》扶雨切，上麌，奉。］
亦作“釡1”。亦作“鬴1”。
(1)古炊器。敛口，圜底，或有二耳。其用如鬲，置于灶口，上置甑以蒸煮。盛行于汉代。有铁制的，也有铜和陶制的。
(2)古量器。也叫“鬴”。春秋、战国时代流行于齐国。现存有战国时的子禾子釜和陈纯釜，都作坛形，小口大腹，有两耳。子禾子釜的容积为20.46公升，陈纯釜的容积为20.58公升。与商鞅量、新莽嘉量的容积已很接近。
(3)用同“斧”。参见“釜斤”。

釜字的英文翻译

◎ 釜
kettle

釜字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　釜； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页1296第08
【廣韻】扶雨切【集韻】奉甫切，?音父。【說文】鬴，或作?。俗省作釜。【古史考】黃帝始作釜。【易·說卦傳】坤爲釜。【疏】取其化生成熟也。【詩·召南】維錡及釜。【註】有足曰錡，無足曰釜。【釋文】釜，符甫反。　又量名。【論語】與之釜。【左傳·昭二年】豆區釜鍾，四升爲豆，各自其四，以登于釜，釜十則鍾。【註】釜，六斗四升，鍾，六斛四斗。　又山名。【史記·封禪書】黃帝合符釜山。【括地志】釜山，在嬀州懷戎縣北。　又【水經注】西海鹽池北，西王母有石室石釜。　又【韻補】叶府九切，音缶。【蘇轍·土牛詩】土牛適成象，逡巡見屠剖。田家挽雙角，歸理鏁絲釜。

釜字的源字形

釜字的起名意思

本义指古炊器。后喻指即将灭亡的事物，如釜底游鱼。或从根本上解决，如釜底抽薪。也指下决心干到底，如破釜沉舟。此外，釜也指量器，也是容量单位的名称。

kettle
Basic explanation of words
kettle
fǔ
An ancient pot: drawing salaries from the bottom of the cauldron. burn one's boats.
The name of the Chinese measuring instrument during the Spring and Autumn Period and the Warring States Period is also a unit of capacity, with different standards.
kettle
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [fǔ]
["Guangyun" Helping the rain to cut, go up, and bong. ]
Also known as "釡1". Also known as "鬴1".
(1) Ancient cooking utensils. Constricted mouth, rounded bottom, or two ears. It is used like a 鬲, placed in the mouth of the stove, and placed on top of the retort for steaming. Popular in the Han Dynasty. There are iron, copper and pottery.
(2) Ancient measuring device. Also called "鬴". It was popular in Qi during the Spring and Autumn Period and the Warring States Period. There are both Zihezi Kettle and Chen Chun Keke from the Warring States Period, both in the shape of an altar, with a small mouth and a big belly, with two ears. The volume of the Zihezi kettle is 20.46 liters, and the volume of the Chen Chun kettle is 20.58 liters. It is very close to the volume of Shang Yang volume and Xin Mang volume.
(3) Use the same "axe". See "Cauldrons".
kettle
English translation of words
◎ Kettle
kettle
kettle
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 Kettle; Kangxi Strokes: 10; Page Number: Page 1296 Page 08
【Guangyun】Fuyuqie 【Jiyun】Fengfuqie, the sound father. [Speaking text] 鬴, or make?. The province is used as a cauldron. [Ancient History] Huangdi began to make a kettle. 【Easy·Said Gua Chuan】Kun is a cauldron. [Sparse] Whichever is metaplastic mature. 【Poetry·Zhaonan】Weiqi and the kettle. [Note] There is a foot that means qi, and no foot is a cauldron. 【Explanation】Cauldron, Fu Fu countered.　Also known as a measure. [The Analects] With the cauldron. [Zuo Zhuan · 2nd Year of Zhao] The kettle bell in the bean area, four raised into beans, each has four, to board the kettle, and the kettle is ten bells. [Note] Kettle, six buckets and four liters, bell, six hu and four buckets.　Also the name of the mountain. 【Historical Records · Feng Chan Book】The Yellow Emperor fits in Busan. 【Including Topography】Busan, in the north of Huairong County, Zhuzhou Prefecture.　[Shui Jing Zhu] In the north of Yanchi in the West Sea, the Queen Mother of the West has a stone chamber and a stone cauldron.　[Rhyme Supplement] Ye Mansion nine cuts, sound fou. 【Su Zhe·Tu Niu Poetry】The Tu Niu is suitable for image formation. Tian Jia pulls the double horns and manages the Caustic Cauldron.
kettle
Source glyph
kettle
Name meaning
The original meaning refers to ancient cooking utensils. Later metaphors refer to things that are about to die, such as fish swimming in the bottom of a cauldron. Or solve it fundamentally, such as drawing a salary from the bottom of the tank. It also refers to making up your mind to do it to the end, like breaking the boat. In addition, the kettle also refers to a measuring device, which is also the name of a unit of capacity.
(缺)
釜位
“釜”是一种古炊器。金文多从
“缶”(参看《汉字演变 500 例》“缶”字
条),“父”声。小篆正体为“。”,或体
从“金”,“父”声。楷书把“金”的前两
笔作了省简。《急就章》: “铁、铁、钻、
锥、釜、镀、整”。
(同楷书)

简化字
画 營金专登
(недостаток)
Чайник
«Чайник» - старинный кухонный инвентарь.
Бронзовое письмо в основном происходит от звука «» (см. Примечание «Фу» в «500 случаях эволюции китайских иероглифов»), звука «отца».
Традиционная форма Сяочжуань - «.», Или форма от «цзинь», «отец».
В обычном шрифте первые два штриха «Золота» упрощены.
«Чрезвычайная глава»: «Утюг, железо, дрель, конус, котел, обшивка и целиком».
Обычный сценарий

fǔ
I сущ. /счётн. слово
